The Off State shall be characterised as follows: -The Remote Terminal Unit consumes no power (with the exclusion of the power monitoring and protection circuitry of the inlet if implemented) -No commands via the Remote Terminal Unit Remote Control Interface are processed -No actuation of any interfaces

The switched off state is characterized as follows: -The Remote Terminal Unit does not consume power (except for the power monitoring and protection circuit of the supply line, if implemented) -No commands are processed via the Remote Terminal Unit Remote Control Interface -No operation of any interfaces

The Initialization State shall be characterised by the following: -The state is entered by Remote Terminal Unit power-on or by a reset signal. -One redundancy of the Remote Terminal Unit Core is activated. -No commands via the Remote Terminal Unit Remote Control Interface are processed. -All configurable settings of the Remote Terminal Unit are initialized to the default values. -All memory areas related to programmable command or actuation sequences are cleared. -No actuation of any interfaces -The overall (redundancy) configuration of the Remote Terminal Unit is set according to the default values. -The Remote Terminal Unit (optionally) executes a self-test as defined in 7.2.2.

The initialization state is characterized as follows: -The state is entered by turning on the Remote Terminal Unit or by a reset signal. -Redundancy of the Remote Terminal Unit Core is activated. -No commands are processed via the Remote Terminal Control Interface. -All configurable settings of the Remote Terminal Unit are initialized to the default values. -All memory areas associated with programmable command or operation sequences are deleted. -No operation of any interfaces -The total configuration (redundancy) of the Remote Terminal Unit is set according to the default values. -The Remote Terminal Unit performs a self-test according to 7.2.2 (optional).
RTT

The initialization state is characterized as follows: -The state is entered by turning on the Remote Terminal Unit or by a reset signal. -A redundancy of the Remote Terminal Unit Core is activated. -No commands are processed via the Remote Terminal Control Interface. -All configurable settings of the Remote Terminal Unit are initialized to the default values. -All memory areas associated with programmable command or operation sequences are deleted. -No operation of any interfaces -The total configuration (redundancy) of the Remote Terminal Unit is set according to the default values. -The Remote Terminal Unit (optional) performs a self test according to 7.2.2.
RTT

The initialization state is characterized as follows: -The state is entered by turning on the Remote Terminal Module or by a reset signal. -Redundancy of the Remote Terminal Module Core is activated. -No commands are processed via the Remote Terminal Control Interface. -All configurable settings of the Remote Terminal Module are initialized to the default values. -All memory areas associated with programmable command or operation sequences are deleted. -No operation of any interfaces -The overall configuration (redundancy) of the Remote Terminal Module is set according to the default values. -The Remote Terminal Module performs a self-test (optional) according to 7.2.2.
RTT

The Remote Terminal Unit shall provide sufficient telemetry to allow the exact state of the Remote Terminal Unit to be determined in Operational State. This includes in particular: -the operating state -on/off status of each switchable module. -the status of any ongoing or pending command execution/actuation -the status of any automatic protection function such as current limiter and overvoltage protections. -the status of any commandable protection function (inhibit/disabled/enabled/armed/disarmed) -all stored status information (volatile and non-volatile) -internal supply voltages -all secondary supply voltages provided to Remote Terminal Unit external users -Remote Terminal Unit internal temperatures -failure status -autonomously taken actionsxinformation if the command(s) could not be executed or if the command has only been partially executed, e.g. due to a wrong operational state of the commanded module. -reporting of bit error detection and correction and memory scrubbing status

The Remote Terminal Unit must have sufficient telemetry to be able to determine the exact status of the Remote Terminal Unit in operation, including in particular: -the operating status -the status of each switchable module. -the status of each running or pending command execution / actuation -the status of each automatic protection function such as current limiter and surge protection. -the status of each commandable protection function (inhibit / disabled / enabled / armed / disabled) -all stored status information (volatile and non-volatile) -internal supply voltages -all secondary supply voltages provided to external users of the Remote Terminal Unit -internal temperatures of the Remote Terminal Unit -failure status -action information taken autonomously when the command (s) could not be executed or the Remote Terminal Unit could not be

The Remote Terminal Unit shall provide sufficient telemetry to allow the exact state of the Remote Terminal Unit to be determined in Operational State. This includes in particular: -the operating state -on/off status of each switchable module. -the status of any ongoing or pending command execution/actuation -the status of any automatic protection function such as current limiter and overvoltage protections. -the status of any commandable protection function (inhibit/disabled/enabled/armed/disarmed) -all stored status information (volatile and non-volatile) -internal supply voltages -all secondary supply voltages provided to Remote Terminal Unit external users -Remote Terminal Unit internal temperatures -failure status -autonomously taken actionsxinformation if the command(s) could not be executed or if the command has only been partially executed, e.g. due to a wrong operational state of the commanded module. -reporting of bit error detection and correction and memory scrubbing status

Any actuator interface function that implements a two stage commanding scheme shall set the “Arm/Disarm” status to “Disarm(Inhibit)” at power-on of the respective functional module, in case of a Remote Terminal Unit reset condition or in case of a time-out of the “Armed” state duration.

Each function of the actuator interface that implements a two-step command scheme sets the "Arm / Disarm" status to "Disarm (Inhibit)" when the respective function module is switched on, in the case of a reset state of the Remote Terminal Unit or in the case of a timeout from the "Armed" state.
